The Cybernetic Middle Way

Jul 5, 2023

Cybernetic notions of life…

Nagarjuna claims objects have no svabhāva. That means organisms have no svabhāva.

Madhyamaka analysis of causation not a dyad, but a triad: cause, effect, and background of supporting conditions or causal field. Not every member of the causal field existentially depends on the effect they jointly bring about (if any of them are at all!) but the collection of these members as such exists only if there is some effect it causes. Assuming that for some objects to form a collection there must be something non-arbitrary that holds them together as one, cf. axiom of choice. Neither causal field, cause, nor effect exist independently of one another or of a cognizing subject (“partly habitual, partly deliberate process of cutting up the complex flow of phenomena into cognitively manageable bits”), they are empty of svabhāva. A causally produced object depends on its cause for existence and therefore doesn’t stand outside of dependence relations with other objects.

    An analysis of the traversed, the not yet traversed, and the presently being traversed.
